medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three years prior to the current admission, characterized by nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and pain in the right upper quadrant. The symptoms were evaluated and initially resolved after hospitalization for bowel rest. One month later, bloating and intermittent abdominal pain returned, increasing in severity over time, culminating in a recent exacerbation of symptoms just prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of Crohn's disease, Clostridium difficile colitis treated 29 months prior, polycystic ovarian syndrome, dysmenorrhea, infertility (leading to in vitro fertilization), and piriformis syndrome. Surgical history includes appendectomy 20 years ago, right inguinal hernia repair 2 years ago, and right knee arthroscopic chondroplasty 3 months ago.
medical_history.family_history: Coronary artery disease in her mother; diabetes and hypertension in her father.
medical_history.social_history: Does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs. Immigrated from India 13 years before presentation; resides with her husband and son in New England.
